statement:
Let $E\subset W$ where $E$ is an open subset of $W$ which is a normed
vector space, and let $f$ be a continuous differentiable map
$$f: E \to W.$$ Then the ordinary differential equation defined as
$$\dot{x} = f(x)$$ with the initial condition $$x(0) = x_0$$ where
$x_0 \in E$ has a unique solution on some interval containing zero. More
specifically there exists $\alpha>0$ such that the following is a unique
function $$x:(-\alpha,\alpha) \to E$$ such that $\dot{x}=f\circ x$ and
$x(0)=x_0$.[@HS]

[1]{} Hirsch, W. Morris, Smale, Stephen.: Differential Equations,
Dynamical Systems, And Linear Algebra. Academic Press, Inc. New York,
1974.
names: existence and uniqueness of solution of ordinary differential equations
